trans-unit.source: Represents a SOAP fault.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription> class represents a SOAP fault in a service contract and is used to create a runtime when a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] service or client application is started.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription"></xref> class using the specified action value.
Creates a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription> object using the specified `action`.
The action of the SOAP fault message.
The value of the action in the SOAP fault message.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription.Action%2A> property to get or set the action of the fault message.
The action of the SOAP fault.
The type of the SOAP fault detail.
The detail type must be serializable.
For details, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultContractAttribute?displayProperty=fullName>.
The type of the serializable detail object.
Gets a value that indicates whether the fault message has a protection level assigned.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceContractAttribute.HasProtectionLevel%2A> property indicates whether the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> property has been set for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription>.
`true` if the fault message has a protection level; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the name of the SOAP fault.
The name of the SOAP fault.
Gets or sets the namespace of the SOAP fault.
The namespace of the SOAP fault.
Specifies the level of protection the SOAP fault requires from the binding.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> property to specify the degree to which the binding must encrypt, sign, or both when sending the SOAP fault.
If a binding supports a higher protection level than required by this property, [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] may disable the unnecessary protection if it is able to do so.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel.None"></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.FaultDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
